Book Your Event With Us â€” Keel Farms | Tampa Bay Winery, Brewery and Restaurant 0 Skip to Content Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Celebrate with us Book Your Event Event Spaces Veranda Holds up to 60 guests Overlook Holds up to 75 guests Need a larger space? Rent both the Veranda and the Overlook for larger parties and hold up to 140 guests. Catering Options Appetizers All appetizers have two sizes based on suggested serving size, small ( serves up to 20 guests) & large (serves up to 40 guests) Chips & Guacamole Bruschetta House Salad Hummus Fruit Tray Pesto Pasta Meatballs Chicken Wings Charcuterie Buffets Cost will be determined per person with a 20 guest minimum FIESTA Mojo Pork | Fajita Chicken Yellow Rice + Black Beans Lettuce, Tomato, Shredded Cheese, Sour Cream & Tortillas Chips & Salsa FAMILY Chicken Marsala Marinara Meatballs Caprese Platter Parmesan Roasted Veggies Buttered Cavatappi Focaccia COUNTRY BBQ Pulled Pork Potato Salad Smoked Gouda Mac + Cheese Collard Greens Slider Rolls GRAND Braised Beef Medallions Mashed Potatoes Oven Roasted Veggies Caesar OR House Salad Desserts All desserts are sold separately, per person Assorted Cookies Cheesecake Key Lime Pie Guava & Cheese Empanadas Looking for something else? Contact us below to explore more options * For event quote, please fill out event contact form below Beverage Options Non-Alcoholic Water, Tea,  & Sodas are included in food purchase Cash Bar Guests are responsible for the purchase of their drinks. 2 for $18 First two drinks on you with drink tickets. Consumption Tab You (the host) purchases what your guests order at the end of your event. Open Bar Prices will be per person and based on length of event * For event quotes, please fill out event contact form below Your perfect event is one click away Where nature's beauty meets rustic elegance, Keel Farms offers a picturesque setting for timeless memories. Our venues, nestled among lush vineyards and our Tasting Room, provide the perfect backdrop for any occasion - a place where every moment becomes a cherished story. We offer table service in our Tasting Room and on our beautiful outdoor patio. We have a wide variety of upscale pub style food, made from fresh ingredients , that are sure to excite your tastebuds. We created an exciting menu that no one can resist. Plan Your Visit â€” Keel Farms | Tampa Bay Winery, Brewery and Restaurant 0 Skip to Content Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Experience Keel Farms Get an inside look at how our wines are made and enjoy a guided tasting experience every day. Learn more about our Keel & Curley Wines and Keel Farms Agrarian Ales & Ciders made right here in Plant City, Florida using local fruits and Florida Cane Sugar Serving up fresh, handcrafted flavors seven days a week! Enjoy our upscale pub-style menu , made with fresh ingredients and bold flavors that are sure to excite your tastebuds. We welcome you to roam our farm as you learn more about our core values and principles every step of the way. Explore our seasonal crops and u-picks during every season. Extend your Keel Farms experience with a stay at The Osprey View , our lakeside farmhouse retreat just 10 minutes away. Enjoy vineyard views, historic charm, and modern comforts. Submit Î” The Maple Sweet Shop Located at our Farm 2519 Effingham St. St. Catharines, ON L2R 6P7 +1-905-682-0642 Daily: 10am - 5pm The Maple Syrup Store Historic Old Town 27 Queen St. Niagara-on-the-Lake, ON L0S 1J0 Sun - Thurs: 10am to 5pm Fri - Sat: 10am to 6pm The Maple Syrup Store Fallsview Casino 6380 Fallsview Blvd, Unit 237 Niagara Falls, ON L2G 7X5 Open Daily 10am to 10pm Tours + Experiences Sugar Bush Trek (March-April) Discover Maple Tour (May-October) Tasting Boards (May-October) School Tours Book a Tour Tour Gift Vouchers Tour Policies Helpful Links Shipping FAQ Firewood Careers Wholesale My Account Cart Contact Us Accessibility Facebook Instagram Land Acknowledgement At White Meadows Farms, we acknowledge that we are situated on the traditional territory of the Haudenosaunee and Anishinaabe peoples, bound by the Dish With One Spoon Wampum Agreement , a treaty of peace and shared responsibility to care for the land and its resources. We are deeply grateful for the generations of knowledge shared by these communities, especially the original makers of maple syrup on this land. We recognize the cultural significance of these forests and remain committed to learning from and honouring the traditions of the Haudenosaunee and Anishinaabe peoples as we carry on the work of maple syrup production. Our Team â€” Keel Farms | Tampa Bay Winery, Brewery and Restaurant 0 Skip to Content Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Meet Our Team Clay Keel President Clay, second-generation owner of Keel Farms. He took over in 2018 with a vision to make Keel Farms a family-friendly experience & has transformed our Tasting Room into what you know and love today. Beyond the farm, Clay and his wife, Carmen, have been happily married for 22 years and are proud parents to two children. A proud veteran, Clay served 23 years in the Army and brings the same dedication to his community. Clay is actively involved in the community through their local non-profit, Spotlight Initiative, USF & local chambers. His passion for service, family & creating memorable experiences drives everything he does at Keel Farms. Wendy Camacho Chief Operating Officer Wendy has been an integral part of the Keel Farms family for over six years, starting as a passionate Brand Ambassador. Her dedication and growth have led her through roles in Sales, Marketing, and Hospitality, culminating in her current position as COO. With a deep connection to the farmâ€™s values of determination, kindness, and authenticity, Wendy leads the team with heart and vision. Her hands-on experience across several departments gives her unique insight into what makes Keel Farms a beloved destination. Wendy is proud to contribute to the farmâ€™s growth and is excited to continue creating exceptional experiences for every guest. Jennifer Mango Chief Financial Officer Jennifer has been an essential member of the Keel Farms team for over three years. She began her journey as a Bookkeeper through her dedication and exceptional skills, quickly advanced to the role of Controller,  HR Director & now CFO. Jenniferâ€™s passion for people and finance is matched by her deep love for Keel Farms and its mission. She is committed to fostering growth for both the team and the organization, and her excitement for the farmâ€™s future is a driving force behind her work. Jenniferâ€™s leadership and financial expertise play a pivotal role in ensuring Keel Farms continues to thrive and achieve its vision. Andrew Shafer Hospitality Director Andrew is originally from Portland, Oregon but has lived in Florida since the early 2010s. He joined the Keel Farms team in 2020 as a Host & has grown through several hospitality roles, ultimately becoming Hospitality Director & has absolutely loved his time here at the farm. Outside of Keel, Andrew enjoys great beer & loves to try new breweries. He is an avid Dungeons & Dragons player & enjoys picking up heavy things & putting them back down. Kieran Carney Chief Wine Maker Kieran, born and raised in Australia, moved to Napa Valley in 2017 as an Assistant Winemaker. With over 20 years in wine production and a Wine Science degree from Charles Sturt University, heâ€™s worked across retail, sales, and vineyards in both Australia and the U.S. Outside of making (and drinking) wine, Kieran enjoys spending time with his wife and his mini Australian Shepherd, Tulip. They enjoy traveling, hiking, skiing, and photography. Josh Henneman General Manager of The Osprey View Josh, the General Manager of The Osprey View, our Wedding Venue located on Lake Thonotosassa. Originally from Indiana, Josh recently moved to Tampa with his wife, their son & two fur babies. Josh began his restaurant career at just 15 years old and has worked his way through every role in the industry. In his free time, you can find Josh spending time with family, watching Cubs games, playing softball, or rewatching Deadpool. & we  couldnâ€™t do it withoutâ€¦ Andy Nassar Chef Jolis Ariss Kitchen Manager Derek Marsh Front of House Manager Taylor Carreira Office Manager Danalyn Viera Bookkeeper Marcus Baker Analyst Cody Lenz Facilities Manger Katie Bock Brand Manager Christy Wallen Sales Manager Carlos Bautista Senior Sales Representative Spencer Gaffney Sales Representative Jordan Parker Account Specialist Be a Part of the Fun Are you interested in being a part of the Keel Farms family and growing with our team? Keel & Curley Winery at Keel Farms â€” Keel Farms | Tampa Bay Winery, Brewery and Restaurant 0 Skip to Content Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Keel & Curley Winery was founded in the spring of 2003, in the farmhouse kitchen of local farmer Joe Keel. Keel, a central Florida blueberry farmer, wanted to find something to do with his end of crop blueberries . He started that spring with 10 gallons of blueberry wine. Each batch was improved until it turned into the unique and charming flavors that Keel & Curley Winery is known for today. Today, Keel & Curley Winery produces three types of blueberry wines, each with a very distinct taste. All three wines are made from 100% blueberries. Also produced at the winery, fusion wines, are wines that are a blend of grape wine and fruit juice. Keel & Curley Winery produces seven different types fusion wines. Join the Club! Subscribe to the Keel & Curley Wine Club for exclusive member discounts, freebies, and of course, Wine! Never miss out on the latest wine releases. Subscribe today! Sign me up! Taste Away. Experience Keel Farms with an immersive wine tasting! You will try eight different Keel + Curley flavors (1oz. pours) along with an in depth personal description of each wine and receive the "Farm Fresh Experience!" Our Keel Farms Tasting Room is open for Wine Tastings for up to ten guests at a time. Tastings are only $15 per person. Now accepting reservations for the busier weekends. Book Now Shop Our Winesï»¿ Never run out of Wine! Check out our wine club subscriptions and get wine straight to your front door! Join the Club See where the magic happens. Book a Winery & Brewery Tour today! Book Now Our tours are offered everyday, save your spot for this unique Winery & Brewery Tour by clicking the button! Fall Activities in Florida for the Entire Family â€” Keel Farms | Tampa Bay Winery, Brewery and Restaurant 0 Skip to Content Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Fall Activities in Florida for the Entire Family Oct 16 Written By Leverage Analytics 1 October 16, 2024 As the air turns a little crisper, Keel Farms welcomes a variety of exciting fall activities that the whole family can enjoy. Our family-owned farm offers a range of autumnal activities that are great for the whole family, making it the perfect spot for a fun-filled day out. Harvest Days at Keel Farms One of the highlights of the fall season at Keel Farms is our Harvest Days festival . This celebration of all things autumn runs every weekend of October and offers a plethora of engaging activities for families. From pumpkin picking to hayrides, thereâ€™s something for everyone to enjoy. Kids will love exploring the corn maze, while parents can unwind in the scenic surroundings with a glass of Florida wine or cider. After you are done participating in various family-friendly events, including live music, craft vendors, and delicious food options featuring local produce, be sure to follow up with a meal at one of the best restaurants in Plant City! Admission to Harvest Days and parking is free for all. Plant City Food Bank Donations for Hurricane Relief Efforts Harvest Days this year (2024) serves to uplift those who need it most after two hurricanes greatly impacted our community. At each Harvest Days event, we will be collecting non-perishable food items for the Plant City Food Bank. Additionally, proceeds from our pumpkin sales will go directly to the Plant City Food Bank to help those affected by Hurricanes Helene and Milton. Football Fun: Bucs Deals all Fall Season As an Official Sangria Partner of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Keel Farms is making fall even more exciting with some special promotions. Join in the spirit of the season with Raise the Flags Friday! When you wear your Bucs gear on Fridays, you can enjoy a free drink of your choiceâ€”whether itâ€™s wine, beer, cider, or a non-alcoholic beverage. Itâ€™s a fantastic way to celebrate your team while savoring the flavors of fall at the farm. And if the Bucs score a win, you can keep the celebrations going with the Bucs Win Deal . After any Bucs victory, enjoy a complimentary Keel Farms Flatbread with the purchase of a drink. Itâ€™s the perfect way to share a meal with friends and family while celebrating your team! Special Events and Activities Keel Farms also features an event calendar packed with seasonal happenings. Whether itâ€™s live music on the weekends, workshops on sustainable farming, or family movie nights under the stars, there's always something exciting happening. Make sure to check our calendar for updates so you donâ€™t miss out on any of the festivities. Plan Your Fall Trip Today A visit to Keel Farms promises an unforgettable experience for families. Spend your day exploring the farm, picking pumpkins, and tasting fresh, local food and Florida wine . Our friendly atmosphere and beautiful scenery create a perfect backdrop for a family outing, and the combination of fall activities and football festivities ensures that everyone has something to do. So, whether youâ€™re in search of the perfect pumpkin, craving a glass of cider, or looking to catch a game day special at one of the best restaurants in Plant City , Keel Farms has you covered this fall. Plan your visit today to experience the joys of autumn in Florida and make the most of your family time! Leverage Analytics 1 Previous Previous Our Favorite Fall Recipes for the Entire Family Next Next Summer Deals For The Entire Family at Keel Farms Our Story | Shop | Events | FAQ | Careers | Distro Location 5202 Thonotosassa Road Plant City, FL 33565 Hours Monday â€“ Thursday 11AM - 9PM Friday & Saturday 11AM - 10PM Sunday 11AM â€“ 7PM Contact Main: 813-752-9100 Office: 813-752-3892 info@keelfarms.com For Sales & Distribution sales@keelfarms.com Returns & Cancellations | Privacy Policy | Copyright Â© 2021 - 2022 | Florida Berry Wines Inc. & Keel Farms Inc. | Website Design by Infotect Design Solutions, Inc.

Careers â€” Keel Farms | Tampa Bay Winery, Brewery and Restaurant 0 Skip to Content Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Join our Keel Farms Team! As a working farm, winery, brewery, and restaurant we are able to offer a variety of career opportunities here at Keel Farms! Recognized as one of the Top Workplaces by the Tampa Bay Times, we work hard to provide our team with a fun, safe, and rewarding place to come to each day. If youâ€™re ready to take on a new, exciting career at Keel Farms then complete the form below and let us know what position you are interested in. Currently Hiring for Line/Prep Cooks We look forward to hearing from you! Privacy Policy 1 â€” Keel Farms | Tampa Bay Winery, Brewery and Restaurant 0 Skip to Content Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop Open Menu Close Menu Our Story Visit Us Events Keel Cares Shop PRIVACY POLICY Keel Farms is committed to protecting your privacy and developing technology that gives you the most powerful and safe online experience. This Statement of Privacy applies to the Keel FarmsÂ  Web site and governs data collection and usage. By using the Keel FarmsÂ  website, you consent to the data practices described in this statement. Collection of your Personal Information Keel Farms collects personally identifiable information, such as your e-mail address, name, home or work address or telephone number. Keel Farms also collects anonymous demographic information, which is not unique to you, such as your ZIP code, age, gender, preferences, interests and favorites. There is also information about your computer hardware and software that is automatically collected by Keel Farms. This information can include: your IP address, browser type, domain names, access times and referring Web site addresses. This information is used by Keel FarmsÂ  for the operation of the service, to maintain quality of the service, and to provide general statistics regarding use of the Keel FarmsÂ  Web site. Please keep in mind that if you directly disclose personally identifiable information or personally sensitive data through Keel Farms public message boards, this information may be collected and used by others. Note: Keel FarmsÂ  does not read any of your private online communications. Keel Farms encourages you to review the privacy statements of Web sites you choose to link to from Keel Farms so that you can understand how those Web sites collect, use and share your information. Keel Farms is not responsible for the privacy statements or other content on Web sites outside of the Keel Farms and Keel FarmsÂ  family of Web sites. Use of your Personal Information Keel Farms collects and uses your personal information to operate the Keel FarmsÂ Web site and deliver the services you have requested. Keel FarmsÂ  also uses your personally identifiable information to inform you of other products or services available from Keel FarmsÂ  and its affiliates. Keel FarmsÂ  may also contact you via surveys to conduct research about your opinion of current services or of potential new services that may be offered. Keel Farms does not sell, rent or lease its customer lists to third parties. Keel FarmsÂ  may, from time to time, contact you on behalf of external business partners about a particular offering that may be of interest to you. In those cases, your unique personally identifiable information (e-mail, name, address, telephone number) is not transferred to the third party. In addition, Keel Farms may share data with trusted partners to help us perform statistical analysis, send you email or postal mail, provide customer support, or arrange for deliveries. All such third parties are prohibited from using your personal information except to provide these services to Keel Farms, and they are required to maintain the confidentiality of your information. Keel FarmsÂ does not use or disclose sensitive personal information, such as race, religion, or political affiliations, without your explicit consent. Keel Farms keeps track of the Web sites and pages our customers visit within Keel Farms, in order to determine what Keel FarmsÂ  services are the most popular. This data is used to deliver customized content and advertising within Keel FarmsÂ  to customers whose behavior indicates that they are interested in a particular subject area. Keel FarmsÂ Web sites will disclose your personal information, without notice, only if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to: (a) conform to the edicts of the law or comply with legal process served on Keel FarmsÂ  or the site; (b) protect and defend the rights or property of Keel Farms; and, (c) act under exigent circumstances to protect the personal safety of users of Keel Farms, or the public. Use of Cookies The Keel FarmsÂ  Web site use "cookies" to help you personalize your online experience. A cookie is a text file that is placed on your hard disk by a Web page server. Cookies cannot be used to run programs or deliver viruses to your computer. Cookies are uniquely assigned to you, and can only be read by a web server in the domain that issued the cookie to you. One of the primary purposes of cookies is to provide a convenience feature to save you time. The purpose of a cookie is to tell the Web server that you have returned to a specific page. For example, if you personalize Keel FarmsÂ  pages, or register with Keel FarmsÂ  site or services, a cookie helps Keel FarmsÂ  to recall your specific information on subsequent visits. This simplifies the process of recording your personal information, such as billing addresses, shipping addresses, and so on. When you return to the same Keel FarmsÂ  Web site, the information you previously provided can be retrieved, so you can easily use the Keel FarmsÂ  features that you customized. You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most Web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline cookies, you may not be able to fully experience the interactive features of the Keel FarmsÂ  services or Web sites you visit. Security of your Personal Information Keel FarmsÂ secures your personal information from unauthorized access, use or disclosure. Keel Farms secures the personally identifiable information you provide on computer servers in a controlled, secure environment, protected from unauthorized access, use or disclosure. When personal information (such as a credit card number) is transmitted to other Web sites, it is protected through the use of encryption, such as the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) protocol. Changes to this Statement Keel Farms will occasionally update this Statement of Privacy to reflect company and customer feedback. Keel FarmsÂ encourages you to periodically review this Statement to be informed of how Keel FarmsÂ  is protecting your information. Contact Information Keel FarmsÂ welcomes your comments regarding this Statement of Privacy. If you believe that Keel Farms has not adhered to this Statement, please contact Keel Farms at info@keelandcurleywinery.com. We will use commercially reasonable efforts to promptly determine and remedy the problem. Keel Farms is home to Keel + Curley Winery and Keel Farms Agrarian Ales and Ciders. At Keel Farms we exist to share our farm and grow the family through remarkable products and experiences. Through hard work on the farm we produce honest, healthy, sustainable, ground to glass products served in a comfortable, family environment. We offer tours, tastings, dining, events, and farm activities year round! Stop by to grab a bite to eat, hop into a tour of our facility, and enjoy our many family-friendly events.
